meanings.definition: Inspect (something) meticulously for tiny flaws or imperfections.
meanings.sent1: She spent hours flyspecking the painting for any hidden flaws.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler was flyspecking each diamond to ensure its quality.
meanings.sent3: After flyspecking the document, she found a small typo that made her chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His attention to detail was so precise, it was like flyspecking a grain of sand.
meanings.sent5: Flyspecking the antique vase revealed a tiny signature hidden at the bottom.

meanings.definition: The act of examining something in great detail for small imperfections.
meanings.sent1: His flyspecking of the car's paint job revealed a small scratch.
meanings.sent2: The artist's flyspecking of the canvas showed the intricate brush strokes.
meanings.sent3: The flyspecking of the cake decoration made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to flyspecking every detail made her a perfectionist.
meanings.sent5: The flyspecking of the manuscript uncovered a hidden message in the margins.
